Case reference: 2011000699.CaseDesc: On 23 May 1985, William Drake walked out of the Pinecrest Home for senior citizens, where he lived.  He was last seen at 9:30 am walking eastbound on highway 17 in Kenora, near the Sunset Husky gas station.  His family and friends have not heard from him since. Mr. Drake is reported to be hard of hearing and diabetic.

Pants: Light Blue, small checks and suspenders

Case reference: 2014001366.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1995, Paul-Henri Hardy was seen for the last time in the St-Romuald sector of Lévis, Quebec. Paul-Henry was 28 years old at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014005728.CaseDesc: On December 12, 2011, James Mayer was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. James had last spoken with his mother on December 14.

Case reference: 2014004138.CaseDesc: On November 15, 2002, Sefacag Erdinc was last seen at his residence in Mission, British Columbia. Since then, Mr. Erdinc has not been seen or heard from.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Moon and Star

Case reference: 2014005499.CaseDesc: During the early morning hours of Friday, October 1st, 2010, Janice Cher Desjarlais and her boyfriend crawled into a dumpster located behind The Center of Hope on Franklin Avenue in Fort McMurray. Janice's boyfriend advised that he left at approximately 7:30 a.m. to go to McDonald’s restaurant. When he returned at around 8:30 a.m., Janice was gone. When he was unable to find her, he suspected that the dumpster may have been emptied during his absence. On October 3rd, video surveillance of the area confirmed that the dumpster had been picked up at 8:22 a.m. on October 1st. It also showed the departure of Janice's boyfriend, but no one else entering or leaving the dumpster. On October 5th, a major excavation of the landfill was started, but by the time the search was completed on October 14th, Janice had not been located.

Case reference: 2020011625.CaseDesc: On or about January 15, 1975, John Alfred Hovey was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Alfred was a known associate of the Toronto mobster, Paul Volpe.

Case reference: 2013000036.CaseDesc: Pierre Roy was last seen on January 28, 1983.  He was involved in an altercation in a bar in Montreal and has not been seen since.

Teeth: Braces, Wears 2 dentures, the top one is welded

Scar: Right Leg, 2 scars on each side of 5" long

Case reference: 2016061073.CaseDesc: On July 13, 1980, the remains of a male was recovered from the Niagara River Whirlpool. His post-mortem length was measured at 5'9"; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he has been in the water for possibly 2 weeks.

Teeth: Has good teeth with several amalgam fillings of the molars.

Case reference: 2014004805.CaseDesc: Patrick Ratto was reported missing from his Burnaby residence July 27, 2006. There have been no confirmed sightings of Mr. Ratto since his disappearance. Mr. Ratto previously resided in Quebec and may have moved back. The Burnaby RCMP would like to speak with anyone who has any information on Mr. Ratto's whereabouts.

Hair: Brown, Short, Small brown & grey goatee

Jacket: Black, White, Windbreaker with white markings and a logo

Case reference: 2020006296.CaseDesc: On October 16, 1964, Carol Turner was last seen with two boys from the Black Diamond Riders Motorcycle Club in Toronto, Ontario. Earlier that evening, Carol had argued with her mother, and left the house after her mother had gone to sleep.

Case reference: 2012020646.CaseDesc: Antonie Medzech was last seen outside the Midtown Plaza in downtown Saskatoon, SK at approximately 8:00 a.m. on December 13, 2002. Mrs. Medzech had been dropped off at that location to go shopping.

Jewelry: Leather, Watch, silver face, black strap

Case reference: 2014006264.CaseDesc: William (Bill) Kwiatek was last seen in Canmore, AB, in July, 1988. He was leaving a bar and was intending to hitchhike back to Calgary but never made it there. Mr. Kwiatek was reported missing in 2013 and very few details of when he was last seen are known.

Amputation: Left Ring Finger, partial missing finger

Case reference: 2012020082.CaseDesc: Katelyn Noble was last seen in the Radisson, SK district in mid August, 2007. Katelyn has had no contact with her family or friends in Mission, BC, and her whereabouts are unknown.

Case reference: 2019013046.CaseDesc: In August 2018, Celia Maria Da Silva was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2011000499.CaseDesc: In August 1996, Bruce Berthelot left his family residence in Leamington, Ontario. M. Berthelot indicated that he was going away for a little while and asked his mother for $1000. He had been unemployed for several months and was dealing with some health issues. Prior to leaving he telephoned his friends in Manitoba a number of times. His family believes that he was headed to Western Canada. He has lived in Manitoba in the past. Mr. Berthelot is a skilled carpenter, and enjoys fishing and boating.  He has had no contact with any members of his family or friends since leaving.

Case reference: 2014004725.CaseDesc: Jack Ford was last seen on September 20, 1991. His abandoned vehicle was located by hunters on a cut line near Cold Lake on September 21 or 28 of 1991. Mr. Ford was reported missing October 16, 1991 by his son.

Case reference: 2014001767.CaseDesc: On October 15, 1991, Mario Chouinard was seen for the last time while hunting on the Zec Festubert(controlled harvesting zone) located in the municipality of Clovas in the Abitibi-Témiscamingue region of Quebec. Mario has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2005000299.CaseDesc: On August 28, 2005, the remains of a female were found in a wooded location at an MTO picnic area on Highway #7 west of Rockwood, Ontario. It is believed the female had been dragged a short distance into the woods, beside the picnic area and had been there for approximately a month before being discovered. A "Woods" sleeping bag had been placed over top of the deceased, covering her. No personal jewelry or identification was found with the deceased. The clothing that she wore was found to have been purchased in the Montreal area. Investigators believe the circumstances of her death are suspicious and consider this foul play.

Hair: Brown, Dyed, Medium length, reddish brown
Teeth: 2 missing upper teeth on the left front and wore a two-tooth partial plate.

Shirt: Beige, Atmosphere, Tank Top, size 10/12, round neck

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Abdomen, left 7th rib of the front rib cage.
Left Cheek, old facial trauma including left eye socket
Nose, Old facial trauma including a broken nose

Case reference: 2018033880.CaseDesc: On February 2, 2005, Quang Le was seen for the last time by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019038949.CaseDesc: On May 8, 2019, Calvin Brown was last seen at his home in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Calvin boarded a flight to Jamaica and was scheduled to return on May 20, but has not returned home.

Case reference: 2015065844.CaseDesc: On December 3, 2015, at approximately 2: 00am, David Howlett was seen for the last time in his home in Paradise, Newfoundland.  David’s car was later located in the area of Cape Spear in St. John’s, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2012020053.CaseDesc: Jennifer Catcheway has been missing since Thursday June 19, 2008. Ms. Catcheway was seen at approximately 12:00 pm leaving Grand Rapids en route to Portage la Prairie, Manitoba.  During her travels it is believed that she was dropped off near the Waterhen junction - Provincial Road 328 and PTH #6. Ms. Catcheway has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2005006499.CaseDesc:
On December 17, 1977, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of Lake Ontario near Long Branch Park, Toronto. Anthropological analysis suggests that he may be Hispanic. 
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 140lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
It is believed that he had been dead for at least one year prior to his discovery.

Teeth: Stained, Several dental fillings and a number of teeth were lost/extracted prior to death. Staining suggest he may have been a smoker.

Jewelry: Brown, Wide brown band on his left wrist, possibly a watch.

Case reference: 2014002404.CaseDesc: On June 11, 1988, Andrew Flett was walking with others to the cutline. Mr. Flett  did not show up at the site and crew members thought he had returned to camp. Mr. Flett  was reported missing three days later to RCMP, and an extensive search was conducted. Mr. Flett  has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Shirt: Red, Black, plaid and button up

Case reference: 2012020107.CaseDesc: Isabelle Bourgeot, 32, was seen for the last time on November 1st, 1985 in the La Cité-Limoilou district in Quebec City, Quebec. At the time of her disappearance Isabelle wasn’t carrying any identification papers. It should be noted that she suffers from amnesia.

Case reference: 2014004817.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2006, Timothy Lang departed his residence in Chilliwack, British Columbia in his vehicle, a grey Chevrolet Metro. Timothy left behind all his personal belongings, wallet, and passport. On September 11, 2006, his vehicle was located in the parking lot of the Othello Tunnels in the Coquihalla Canyon Provincial Park, located in Hope, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2017070398.CaseDesc: Randy Whitcher was seen for the last time on November 29, 2017 at approximately 10 a.m. in the 11000 Block of the Westminster Highway in Richmond, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2012020132.CaseDesc: François Robillard's family reported his disappearance on July 16, 2010. François' associate, Guy Verdon was also reported missing around the same time.

Case reference: 2017013576.CaseDesc: Hellen Ermias and her daughter Lina Tedros entered Canada seeking asylum.  They were provided a temporary apartment but disappeared shortly after with no explanation and without their belongings.

Case reference: 2014003250.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1974, four people left the Whitedog Indian Reserve, Ontario in a 14' Lund boat and were heading for Pointe du Bois, Manitoba. Their intention was to go to Pointe du Bois to pick up supplies and then return to Whitedog. On November 5, 1974, these individuals were reported missing as they had never returned to Whitedog.  It is believed that the boat overturned and everyone drowned. Two bodies were recovered, and the cause of death was determined to be drowning. Searches were conducted by boat and by air but the bodies of Paul Scott and Richard Petawanahqueb were never recovered.  Mr. Scott and Mr. Petawanahqueb are presumed dead due to drowning. No foul play is suspected.

Case reference: 2012020018.CaseDesc: Sahil Sharma has been missing from the Newton area of Surrey, B.C. since November 13, 2008.  On the day Sahil disappeared, he had attended to Kwantlen University in Surrey, B.C. to pay for his upcoming semester to study Information Technology.  Sahil did not have any known drug or alcohol addictions and no known mental health issues.  Sahil's disappearance is highly out of character and all avenues of investigation have not provided any information on his whereabouts.

Sweater: Grey, Red, Red stripes on the neck

Tattoo: Right Forearm, "RAM" written in Hindi symbols

Case reference: 2017047885.CaseDesc: On July 31, 2017, Brayden Thibault was seen for the last time when he left Fredericton, New-Brunswick to meet someone in the City of Moncton, New-Brunswick. Brayden has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014007307.CaseDesc: On the 28th of May, 1987, a small shed was moved and a body of what appeared to be a full term infant was found. It had been wrapped in two towels and placed under the shed. Examination of the body was done by the University Of Saskatchewan Department Of Archaeology. It was determined the body was that of a full or part North American Indian and had been there from one to three years. The sex of the infant could not be determined. This case is being investigated by the Office of the Chief Coroner and the Royal Canadian Mounted Police.

Case reference: 2006026199.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1976 an unidentified male, believed to be between the ages of 30 to 40 years old, was found in the Niagara River, Niagara Falls, Ontario. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 150-200 lbs and his length was measured at 5’5”-6'0", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, The names "Mary and Kim" in blue with a red flower on a green background

Case reference: 2006024299.CaseDesc: Harold Cottrell was last seen on September 28, 1984, in a boat on Northwind Lake.  It is believed the aluminum boat he was travelling in with some companions, was overloaded.  The boat began to sink.  Mr. Cottrell was never located and is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2020008549.CaseDesc: On March 26, 1976, at approximately 12:30pm, Licelia D’Costa was last seen by her landlady in Toronto, Ontario. Licelia had told her roommate that she was headed to Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001192.CaseDesc: On November 13, 1983, the partial remains of a young adult male were found on the south side of Cracroft Island. He was partially clothed in a wetsuit, and may have been out fishing when he went missing. The last joint of the little finger on his left hand was amputated. He is estimated to have gone missing sometime in 1982 or 1983.

Pants: Cloth, Gold, Small sweatpants with drawstring waist

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Little Finger, Amputation of left pinky finger

Case reference: 2018034585.CaseDesc: On September 1, 2004, at approximately 8:00 am, Stephen Lawrence was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Stephen had said he would be home in a few hours.

Shirt: Blue, Brand: Calvin Klein; long sleeves

Case reference: 2014005039.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1983, Azim Ramji was seen for the last time as he left his home in Kitchener, Ontario, after telling his family that he was leaving for Niagara Falls. Later that day, Azim’s vehicle was found at the Skylon Tower in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Azim was despondent.

Case reference: 2005005299.CaseDesc:
On January 2, 1995, the partial skeletal remains of an unidentified man were found in front of a children's playground adjacent to Lake Ontario near Navy and Front Streets in Oakville. 
The time since death is estimated to be months to several years.

Case reference: 2014003215.CaseDesc: On June 24, 1972, a group of seven people, including Hank Ethier, were fishing on the Burntwood River. Late in the day the group and their two boats went to shore for supper. One group, which included Hank, left the shore. They were however unable to get their boat started and as a result they began to drift backwards towards the rapids. This group called for help and the other boat went to their aid. Hank jumped from his boat and swam to the second one. Once they reached the disabled boat everyone was told to get in. Both boats encountered the rapids. It is assumed Hank drowned as a result of the mishap.

Case reference: 2008023599.CaseDesc: Gordon Andrew Cameron was reported missing by a family member on March 26, 1993. He was last seen on February 28, at Lino's Restaurant and has not been seen or heard from since.  At the time of his disappearance he was self-employed as an auto-body repairman. His shop was located at Brule Road and Highway 2 in Kingston. Foul play is suspected in his disappearance.

Case reference: 2012020085.CaseDesc: Benjamin Entz was born and raised on the Waldeck Hutterite Colony near Waldeck, SK and resided there up until the time he went missing. He was described by friends and family as being a loner who kept to himself. Mr. Entz left the colony on the evening of 2011-09-18 at which time he was seen driving away on a tractor which was later recovered the following day. The investigation/search for Mr. Entz has involved numerous witness interviews, air and ground searches, and media releases, however he has yet to be located.

Case reference: 2020018574.CaseDesc: Steven WOYTOWICH is believed to be homeless and was last seen in the Beverly area of Edmonton, Alberta, in early March of 2020.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, lady on a mushroom

Case reference: 2014005260.CaseDesc: On May 31, 2009, at approximately 6:00 p.m., Gordon Farrow was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Gordon advised that he was going to Sudbury, Ontario, but has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2015022096.CaseDesc: On March 1, 2015, at approximately 10:30 a.m., Karrie-Ann Henry was seen for the last time leaving her home with some of her belongings.

Case reference: 2014005502.CaseDesc: Pinaskin Ottawa was last seen shopping on October 11, 2010, around 11:00 AM at the Atikamekw Community Grocery Store in Manawan. Since then, several investigations have been conducted in the vicinity of Manawan without success. He has not been seen or heard from since

Case reference: 2020007343.CaseDesc: Marie Lyons had been living with her aunt after she had fled from her abusive husband. On April 12, 1971, Marie was last seen when her husband picked her up from her aunt’s residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Shoes: Brown, Laced; Low cut with laces

Case reference: 2014005752.CaseDesc: On the early morning of March 31, 2007, Candace Shpeley was last seen in Chilliwack, British Columbia. There is reason to believe that Ms. Shpeley, a resident of Abbotsford, British Columbia, was travelling from a friend’s residence on the day of her disappearance. Her vehicle, a 1995 green Pontiac Grand Am, was recovered near the Renfrew sky train station in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014001925.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1976, Maggie Natomagan, 74 years old, was last seen in Pinehouse, Saskatchewan. Mrs. Natomagan was known to walk in the bush near the community, however, searches failed to locate any trace of her.

Case reference: 2014003102.CaseDesc: On July 31, 1972, David Kyak was seen for the last time in Iqaluit, Nunavut.

Hat: Canvas, Blue, Ball cap, Polar bear crest

Case reference: 2014003618.CaseDesc: Maggie Mink was last in contact with her family in 1985; at the time, she indicated that she was moving to Vancouver from Manitoba. Ms. Mink was documented to be living in Vancouver's west end in 1987. There have been no further records of Ms. Mink since.

Case reference: 2021037680.CaseDesc: Augustine Moloi went missing from Calgary, Alberta, in October 2008. Augustine's family has not seen or heard from him since this time.

Case reference: 2014006160.CaseDesc: On November 28, 1978, George Heys left his residence for an appointment in Toronto, Ontario. George has not been seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014001853.CaseDesc: On May 19, 1958, Clifford McKell and a friend were last seen having supper and told friends they were going out in the canoe. Neither of the men were considered experienced paddlers. No one witnessed the men leaving in the canoe. The following day they were reported missing by their employer when they failed to report to work. Police commenced an investigation and an air search found the overturned canoe. Paddles and safety cushions were also located. A witness who saw two men in a canoe around 8:30 pm indicated they were headed in a southerly direction and the lake was quite rough at the time. It is presumed Mr. McKell drowned.

Case reference: 2017040791.CaseDesc: On the night of July 16, 2017, Thomas Burke was seen for the last time leaving his home in Liverpool, Nova Scotia. Thomas had left after a family meeting over financial issues. It did not appear that he took anything with him.

Case reference: 2014006149.CaseDesc: On February 7, 1971,  Selina Wallace spent the day with family and friends socializing. In the evening, Selina and friends went to a pier near the family home. The family last saw Selina on the pier with a male friend. When Selina did not return home the following day, family and community members searched the nearby area. The tidal currents near the pier are extremely strong and any person in the water could travel a great distance in a short period of time.

Scar: Right Hand, Circular scar under right thumb, outside of hand

Case reference: 2014005597.CaseDesc: On October 1, 2010, André Benoit was last seen at his home in Sainte-Marguerite-du-Lac-Masson. André may have gone to Montreal in the days preceding his disappearance. The attempts to locate Mr. Benoit have been negative to this date.

Case reference: 2006020599.CaseDesc: Simon Angeconeb was last seen on July 10, 1993 at Cat Island Lodge located on Red Lake in the District of Kenora, Ontario. He was heading to his cabin to go to sleep and has not been seen since. Mr. Angeconeb may have been suffering from a concussion.

Case reference: 2022001276.CaseDesc: On December 31, 2021, Emily Bailey was seen for the last time in Hamilton, Ontario. Emily is known to live a transient lifestyle, but is also known to remain in constant contact with her friends and family via social media. All of her social media activity has stopped since December 27, 2021.

Backpack: Light Blue, Black, Has black handles

Case reference: 2014005817.CaseDesc: On January 13, 2008, August Mikson was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020125.CaseDesc: Serge Crevier was last seen on July 17, 2006, around 1:30 pm at his residence in Gatineau. The car that he was using, a grey Oldsmobile Alero 2002, was found on September 10, 2006 in Thorne, in the Outaouais region.

Case reference: 2006003699.CaseDesc: On July 26, 2002, a male, believed to be between the ages of 30 to 40 years old, was found in the Don River, north of the Queen Street East Bridge. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 217 lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been dead for a few days.

Teeth: Full gold crown lower right first molar, a dental implant replacing upper right central incisor, multiple amalgam restorations.

Shirt: Red, T-shirt with indistinguishable white lettering

Case reference: 2014005158.CaseDesc: Mr. Frederick Lagrelle was last seen on April 12, 1997 in the area of the Sunchild and O’Chiese First Nations in Alberta. It is possible Mr. Lagrelle was seen in Rocky Mountain House, Alberta days after. He was known to walk with a cane and wear a leg/knee brace. Mr. Lagrelle was described by family as having an intellectual disability as a result of a past accident.

Case reference: 2017020043.CaseDesc: Louis Judah Gonick was seen being picked up by taxi cab at his University dormitory residence at 7:09 PM, April 16, 2017, and was last seen at 7:32 PM, being dropped off at the Stanley Park causeway.

Case reference: 2014002146.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1984, John Lake  was last seen leaving a hospital in Vancouver, British Columbia. He stated he was heading to Seattle.

Scar: Left Side Of Head, From ear to chin

Case reference: 2006004499.CaseDesc: James Pearce was last seen in the Grafton area on October 5, 1999. On October 8, 1999, his 1949 pink Dodge pick-up truck was located at the Cobourg train station parking lot.

Hair: Brown, Straight, Brush Cut, Recent #2 cut at time of disappearance

Tattoo: Right Hand, Banner with the name Laurie
Left Arm, Skeleton with top hat
Scar: Torso (Back), Numerous scars from an accident
Head, A 1 inch scar under hair on left side
Left Leg, Scar from a fracture

Case reference: 2013000013.CaseDesc: On April 27, 1967, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Marianne Schuett was seen for the last time in the vicinity of the Kilbride Public School's driveway in North Burlington, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Marianne was seen talking to an unknown man in a vehicle, and it is believed that she was abducted by this man.

Hair: Brown, Bangs in front, ear length at back

Case reference: 2009000199.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1996, Alf Joergensen left his residence to go on a business trip to London, England. Mr. Joergensen told his wife he would be returning on either October 22nd or 23rd. He indicated he was meeting a business associate in London, however it was later confirmed there were no scheduled  business meetings with this particular individual, who hadn't seen Mr. Joergensen since the previous year. Mr. Joergensen flew to England on October 17, 1996 and was confirmed to have flown into Toronto airport on October 19, 1996, via British Airways. He has not been seen nor heard from since this date and his family and police are concerned for his safety and well-being.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Rear teeth both sides of upper jaw missing.  Dental records available.

Case reference: 2014001124.CaseDesc: The skeletal skull of a young middle-aged woman was found by a hunter on September 10, 1994, in a wooded area east of Golden, British Columbia. She may have had a dental overlap at the front and would have died about 5 years earlier.

Case reference: 2019019954.CaseDesc: On April 14, 2019, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Yonis and Mawahib Ahmed were seen for the last time with their mother Liyana Abdow at the Sojourn House in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006021199.CaseDesc: Guy Labreche and Rick Dechaine were last seen at the airport in Sioux Lookout, Ontario on September 12, 1987 as they departed on a return air trip to Thunder Bay, Ontario. Mr. Labreche was the aircraft pilot and his Cessna is presumed to have crashed.

Case reference: 2014006419.CaseDesc: On January 23, 2014, Ally Hassan Mabruki was seen for the last time at one of Toronto's Refugee Intake Shelters in Ontario. Staff members overheard Ally stating he was going to visit his lawyer regarding his refugee claim.

Case reference: 2012020149.CaseDesc: These partial skeletal remains were recovered 11 km south of Highway #1 on Greenstone Road in the Dominic Lake area, approximately 22 km west of Kamloops.

Case reference: 2014002896.CaseDesc: On October 25, 1981, at around 10:00pm, Madeleine Thibault was seen for the last time on Commercial Road in Lévis, Québec. While leaving her house, Madeleine mentioned that she was going to her mother's for a visit.

Jewelry: Gold, COLLIER, Chain with two hearts

Mark: Mouth, Beauty mark on the left side

Case reference: 2012020051.CaseDesc: Emily Ballantyne departed Lynn Lake the evening of April 27, 1991, heading to Thompson, MB with two male acquaintances. It is believed the trio arrived in Thompson late that evening, and they went their separate ways.  Ms Ballantyne has not been seen since and her whereabouts remain unknown.

Jacket: White, blue and pink on shoulder and elasticized waist

Case reference: 2016024223.CaseDesc: Joseph Amiro was last seen leaving the Queen Elizabeth II Health Sciences Centre in Halifax, Nova Scotia on May 1, 2016.  Mr. Amiro suffers from medical issues that require daily medication. He is known to wear glasses and walk with a cane. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020006647.CaseDesc: On June 27, 1980, Ophlin Facey was seen for the last time as she left the residence of her employer. During the time of her disappearance, Ophlin was a live-in house keeper, and it is possible she may have been heading to a party that day.

Case reference: 2012020655.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2008, Wilson Grant Nokohoot was seen for the last time on the 1800 block of Smith Street, Regina, Saskatchewan. It is unusual for Mr. Nokohoot to not have regular contact with family and acquaintances.

Case reference: 2014006184.CaseDesc: On October 15, 1977, Jacques Chaput left the family home in Trois-Rivières, Quebec following a disagreement he had with his mother and he never returned. Numerous steps were taken by his family to locate him, but they were unsuccessful. Jacques was officially declared missing by his family in 2013.

Case reference: 2020051730.CaseDesc: On Dec 10, 2020, Gurpreet Singh Parmar was last seen on a video surveillance camera walking away from his family residence in Abbotsford, British Columbia.  Gurpreet has not been seen or heard from since.

Backpack: Other, Lunch bag or Lunch pail with shoulder strap
Hat: Other, Possibly wearing a brimmed hat
Pants: Other, Possibly wearing dark pants or sweatpants
Sweater: Other, Dark coloured sweater, hoodie or jacket, possibly red

Case reference: 2006003399.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2001, this male, was found in a sewer at 470 Lansdowne Avenue in Toronto. His ancestry is Caucasian, possibly Egyptian or mixed African/Caucasian. He had previous surgery of his left forearm, which had involved the implant of surgical plates. The numbers visible on the surgical plates could not be traced to a specific individual, however, it was determined that the lot was released some time after May 25, 1994. A MacDonald’s name tag with the name "Raymond" was found in the sewer, which may or may not be related to this individual.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were stained, which suggests he may have been a smoker,  his upper central incisors were also missing

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Hip, recent fracture of left hip

Case reference: 2014004979.CaseDesc: On July 23, 2007, Gad Krespine, a resident of Montreal, was last seen at approximately 10:30 am at 1755 Lierre Street in Laval, Quebec.

Case reference: 2020007818.CaseDesc: On August 11, 1972, at approximately 12:00pm, Harvey Tulley was seen for the last time by the building’s superintendent in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Harvey was despondent.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Thumb, Bent towards index finger

Case reference: 2014001801.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1992, Marshall Holmes wandered into the bush near Vassar, Manitoba and has not been seen since. Mr. Holmes was 73 years old at the time and was described as a recluse and a hermit. Mr. Holmes had gone missing in the past and had returned on his own accord. He enjoyed being in the bush and liked to sleep in the long grass. The last time he went missing he was gone for 3 days and came out of the bush when he became hungry. Extensive searches were done by land, air and with the assistance of a police dog. Marshall Holmes has never been located.

Jacket: Nylon, Blue, White, Has 3 vertical stripes

Case reference: 2014004511.CaseDesc: On July 29, 2004 George Davis left a residence near Creston, BC to get cigarettes. He was driving a 1981 brown Chrysler Lebaron with a British Columbia licence plate. The vehicle has not been recovered.

Mark: Eyes, Mole lower lid right eye

Case reference: 2006026499.CaseDesc: Simon McDonald was last seen on May 9, 2001, leaving his daughter's residence on the White Dog, First Nations Territory. He was known to enjoy walking along the river. Extensive searches of the area have failed to locate Mr. McDonald.

Hair: Black, Grey, Unkempt; Beard, Moustache, Sideburns

Shoes: Cloth, Red, Black, slippers with leather soles.

Case reference: 2014006316.CaseDesc: Andrew William Munro was last seen in Stewart, British Columbia on November 15, 2013. Police and family are concerned for his well being as he needs daily medication. He may be clean shaven or have a goatee. Mr. Munro may have been crossing the border between British Columbia and Alaska. Mr. Munro was a long time lower mainland resident who had recently moved to Stewart, to pursue a career in the logging industry.

Hair: Brown, Short, Sometimes has a goatee.

Case reference: 2014006340.CaseDesc: On January 16, 2002 Anatoli Dibrov went out in the evening for about 1/2 hour. When he came home he appeared secretive. Mr. Dibrov went to bed that evening and that was the last time he was seen. Originally from Russia, it's possible he may have returned.

Boots: Brown, Red, Reddish/brown with red fur trim (only available in Russia)
Gloves: Brown, Grey, Brown mittens or grey gloves

Case reference: 2016065869.CaseDesc: On April 11, 1976, the decomposed remains of a male individual were recovered from the water in Port Arthur Marina in the Thunder Bay Harbour. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 170-180 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His pockets contained a red handkerchief, pipe for smoking, book of matches and a broken pencil. It is believed that he had been in the water since the fall of 1975.

Hair: Brown, receding hairline and a moustache

Ring: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Brass ring with a silver finish on the small finger of his left hand

Scar: Right Abdomen, Long wide scar on his upper abdominal region

Case reference: 2014001708.CaseDesc: Marlene Abigosis was last seen in March of 1984 in the downtown east side of Vancouver. Ms. Abigosis was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. M. Abigosis was known to work near the docks, and clients that owned boats would take Marlene with them on trips to Washington State and Vancouver Island on occasion.

Case reference: 2012020058.CaseDesc: Roger Keesick has been missing since May of 1986.  He is very handy with woodworking and renovating.  He is also known to associate with a lot of street people.  Mr. Keesick last told his family that he was going to work at a fishing lodge outside of Winnipeg.  It was later discovered that he had never made it there.

Scar: Report only indicates "body scars"; no location indicated

Case reference: 2014004614.CaseDesc: Jacob Miller has gone missing in the past, however he has always returned. Mr. Miller was last seen in Winnipeg, MB going for a walk carrying a green backpack and appearing quite disheveled.

Case reference: 2012020117.CaseDesc: On November 24, 1995, Chantal Picotte was reported missing by her mother. Chantal was last seen on the evening of Wednesday, November 22, 1995 at a bar in Saint-Jérôme, Quebec.  She had called her mother that evening asking her to come see her. The next day, Chantal's mother went to her daughter’s residence, but Chantal was not there. The mother made several attempts to call her daughter without any success.

Case reference: 2016012810.CaseDesc: On March 12th, 2016 shortly after midnight, Denny Poole and a friend left Dawson Creek with the intent of heading to Fort St John. It is unknown if they intended to walk, hitchhike, or had other means to get there. The duo became disoriented and ended up wandering the highway and back roads for over 20 hours. It was learned that neither of them was prepared to be out for this period of time. At some point, Denny and his friend had a difference of opinion on whether they should continue on their journey or not, and the two ended up separating. The last confirmed sighting of Denny was just south of the Kiskatinaw Bridge on Highway 97. Denny has some disabilities and it is recommended that he be under adult supervision.

Shoes: Black, Purple, green and white "Osiris" brand
Sweater: Grey, Dark grey hoodie with red "DGK" symbol

Case reference: 2018055666.CaseDesc: On October 18, 1991, Kristina Rhodes was seen for the last time in Port Elgin, Ontario. Kristina was also known to frequent the towns of Southampton and Hanover, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020138.CaseDesc: The 18 month old Yohanna went missing after the mother entrusted the custody of her daughter to her boyfriend while she was out of town for a few days. They all lived in the Saint Laurent area in Montreal. Upon her return to Montreal, the mother was told that her baby was in Washington with the boyfriend’s mother. She went to the United States to find her daughter, but could not locate her. Returning to Quebec, the mother alerted the police of her child’s disappearance. The boyfriend claimed then that the child drowned in the bathtub during the mother’s absence and that she had been buried before the mother’s return. He was questioned and then released due to lack of evidence.

Case reference: 2017074201.CaseDesc: On August 23, 1995, the remains of an unidentified man were discovered in Lake Ontario, near Cherry Beach, in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he may be of European ancestry.

Case reference: 2014043144.CaseDesc: On August 3, 2014, Aaron Dragonetti was seen for the last time in the downtown area of St. John’s Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2020001463.CaseDesc: On August 24, 2018, Sharon Gronfeldt was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.
